title: Ticket #1771: KFLOPS in condor_status -run -tot overflows
description:
Observed behavior: 
> condor_status -run -tot -pool cm.chtc.wisc.edu
                     Machines         MIPS       KFLOPS   AvgLoadAvg

       INTEL/WINNT51        2         4304      1215712   1.005
        X86_64/LINUX     1200     10893323  -1786692936   2.338

               Total     1202     10897627  -1785477224   2.336

Expected behavior: KFLOPS is never negative.

Other fields are also likely vulnerable but KFLOPS happens to be fairly large per machine to start.
remarks:
2010-Nov-19 07:04:55 by matt:
This looks like a defect instead of a todo, what version was it fixed it?
check_ins:
2011-Jan-21 17:10   Check-in [25870]: Document #1771, fix to Kflops reported as negative. (By Alan De Smet )
2010-Nov-17 15:44   Check-in [19420]: Modern machines report large enough KFlops that the summary report values could easily exceed a 32-bit signed integer. Result: negative numbers. Fixed to use uint64_t for kflops Fixes #1771 (By Alan De Smet )
